result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarvis B Rockamore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees, as to each count, on or before 07-01-2017.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
-Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.

with credit for 41 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, and as to each count.

Defendant will serve the 1st five (5) days at the House of Correction (HOC), STRAIGHT TIME. After this initial period of incarceration, if the Defendant have no major rules violations, and are accepted into the Day Reporting Program (DRP), the Defendant may serve the balance of the sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program (DRP).  The Court will have no objection to the Defendant being placed on EM (Electronic Monitoring) while participating in the program.  Should the Defendant violate either  the conditions of this EM (Electronic Monitoring) or the rules at the Day Reporting Program (DRP) the Defendant will serve the balance of the sentence without release privileges. Possession or use of any illegal controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the Huber (work release) privileges and any deferral of reporting time.
Consecutive to: Count 2

*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms and weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarvis B Rockamore

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of MOTION/SCHEDULING commencing FEBRUARY 25, 2015 received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to MR. MICHAEL HOLZMAN  400 WEST MORELAND BOULEVARD  WAUKESHA, WI 53188-2412  PUBLIC DEFENDER APPOINTMENT.
No reply from defendant or surety.
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Jarvis B Rockamore in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. Additional statements made by Defendant's father Cedric Rockamore.

PSI Report reviewed by all parties.

AS TO COUNT 2: COURT ORDERED THE  Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC) consecutive to any other sentence, and as to each count, with credit for 41 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 3:  COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction (HOC) to run consecutive as to Count 2.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING;
*  As to Count 3, the Defendant will serve the 1st five (5) days at the House of Correction (HOC), STRAIGHT TIME. After this initial period of incarceration, if the Defendant have no major rules violations, and are accepted into the Day Reporting Program (DRP), the Defendant may serve the balance of the sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program (DRP).  The Court will have no objection to the Defendant being placed on EM (Electronic Monitoring) while participating in the program.  Should the Defendant violate either  the conditions of this EM (Electronic Monitoring) or the rules at the Day Reporting Program (DRP) the Defendant will serve the balance of the sentence without release privileges. Possession or use of any illegal controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the Huber (work release) privileges and any deferral of reporting time.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees, as to each count, on or before 07-01-2017.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms and weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Jarvis B Rockamore in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT    Case called at 2:00 p.m.  Defendant appears in Court.  Defendant has tested positive for use of THC.  Court finds the defendant is not in compliance with the conditions of the bond.  Court orders the bail forfeited and orders the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Case remains set for sentencing on 11-23-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.

Defendant Jarvis B Rockamore in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 2 & 3 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.  Because of the possibility of incarceration, the defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence on the next date. 

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.  Case set for sentencing on 11-23-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.
